text: Harold John Charles (26 June 1914 - 11 December 1987) was an Anglican priest.St Asaph Cathedral web-site Charles was born into an ecclesiastical familyHis father was the Rev. David Charles sometime Vicar of Newchurch >"Who was Who" 1897-2007 London, A & C Black, 2007 and educated at Keble College, Oxford. Ordained in 1938,"Who was Who" 1897-2007 London, A & C Black, 2007 he began his career with a curacy at Abergwili. After this he was the Bishop's Messenger for the Diocese of Swansea and Brecon until 1948 and then warden of the University Church Hostel, Bangor and a lecturer at University College until 1952. He was then vicar of St James' BangorBangor Civic Society and then in 1954 the warden of St Michael's College, Llandaff. In 1957 he became Dean of St Asaph and in 1971 its diocesan bishop.The Times, 4 February 1971; p. 16; Issue 58090; col D Church news He retired in 1982. ==References== Category:1914 births Category:Alumni of Keble College, Oxford Category:Academics of Bangor University Category:Deans of St Asaph Category:Bishops of St Asaph Category:20th-century Anglican bishops Category:1987 deaths Category:Alumni of St Michael's College, Llandaff Category:Wardens of St Michael's College, Llandaff
